definitions.definition: A coin made of gold or silver, minted at Byzantium and used in currency throughout mediaeval Europe.
A roundel or (that is, a golden circle), the heraldic representation of a gold coin.

main_definition: ( history ) A coin made of gold or silver, minted at Byzantium and used in currency throughout mediaeval Europe.
secondary_definitions: ( heraldry ) A roundel or (that is, a golden circle), the heraldic representation of a gold coin.
